qas.question: What was the name of the redevelopment passage that was passed in 1993?
What is one thing that was added in this project?
How much money was invested in MAPS by 2010?

context: In 1993, the city passed a massive redevelopment package known as the <a0_0>Metropolitan Area Projects<a0_0/> (MAPS), intended to rebuild the city's core with civic projects to establish more activities and life to downtown. The city added a new <a1_0>baseball park<a1_0/>; central library; renovations to the civic center, convention center and fairgrounds; and a water canal in the Bricktown entertainment district. Water taxis transport passengers within the district, adding color and activity along the canal. MAPS has become one of the most successful public-private partnerships undertaken in the U.S., exceeding <a2_0>$3 billion<a2_0/> in private investment as of 2010. As a result of MAPS, the population living in downtown housing has exponentially increased, together with demand for additional residential and retail amenities, such as grocery, services, and shops.
